title: Calories in Fried Chicken Wings
meta_description: Learn calories in chicken wings fried per 100g, including protein, fat, carbs, sodium, and tips for variations to fit your diet.
assumptions: Batter-dipped, deep-fried in vegetable oil; meat and skin included; no additional sauce or seasoning.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by preparation, batter type, oil used, wing size, and brand. Check labels or recipes for precision.

quick_answer.text: 100g of fried chicken wings provides ~327 kcal, with high fat from frying and ~18g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g fried chicken wings?
faqs.a: Approximately 327 kcal for batter-dipped, fried chicken wings with skin.

faqs.q: Are fried chicken wings high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, about 22g total fat per 100g, mostly from the skin and frying oil.

faqs.q: What's the protein in fried chicken wings?
faqs.a: Around 18g protein per 100g, making them a decent source despite the calories.

faqs.q: Do fried chicken wings have carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, ~10g carbs per 100g mainly from the batter; fiber is low at 0.3g.

faqs.q: How does baking affect calories in chicken wings?
faqs.a: Baked wings have ~200-250 kcal per 100g, lower than fried due to less oil absorption.
